title: Tuesday, 9th April 2019

BE11:21am

At the bondholder meeting today the waiver of the dividend restriction was approved and the initial 10c/sh (US$27.9m) final dividend is proposed for 2018, to be paid on 24th June 2019 subject to approval at the 16th May 2019 AGM. The company intends to announce a 5c/sh (~US$14m) interim dividend with the H1 19 results (6th August 2019). As a reminder Genel initiated a sustainable cash returns policy with the 2018 year-end results at a minimum level of US$40m pa, equating to a yield of ~5%, with the intention to grow this over time. The bond covenants restrict payout to a maximum of 50% of net income; Genel reported a loss in 2018 owing to a large noncash writedown on the Miran gas discovery, hence this restriction had to be lifted in order to make a payment during calendar 2019. Although today’s announcement does not change the scale of the cash returns, it does accelerate the start of the cash returns program. Net cash stands at US$81m at the end of February, after generating FCF of US$164m in 2018, and Genel expects to generate more than US$100m FCF at US$60/bbl Brent in 2019 whilst continuing to invest in growth projects; the dividend is well-funded and will come alongside investment in profitable growth. We forecast Genel has the potential to generate FCF (after all capex and financing costs) equivalent to the current market cap over the next 4 years at US$75/bbl Brent. Oil prices may of course be lower, but the cash generation potential of the business is less leveraged to oil prices than most peers. Genel trades at 0.65x our discovered resource NAV, a discount to the sector on 0.71x; note we utilise a 15% discount rate in calculating our risked NAV for Genel, vs 10% for most of the peers.

FATDAZ Here is alink to that podcast I would say it's a must listen https://ritholtz.com/2019/04/transcript-michael-lewis-on-mib/
Valdemar @BE Crikey 15%?

BE11:22am

Blank canvas if you have time, BE, anything on ITV and WPP?
11:23 am
BE11:23am

We make small adjustments to our commodity price and exchange rate assumptions which result in an average 2% reduction in target prices across our coverage. We raise our Brent price assumption to $64.6/bbl FY19 (from $60/bbl) but maintain $65/bbl from 2020, and we adjust our sterling exchange rate to US$1.30 from $1.25. Combined these result in an average 2% reduction to our target prices. There are two target price change outliers: ENQ (+10%), reflecting the gearing to oil prices and post FY18 results; and OPHR where the agreed PT Medco cash offer is 12% below our previous target price.
We make three rating changes:
DNO: reduce to HOLD (from Buy) after positive market performance recently. We maintain our NOK 18/sh target price.
HUR: reduce to SPEC BUY (from Buy) as we believe the share price could be more volatile around the Lancaster field start-up in the next couple of months. We trim our target price to 110 p/sh (from 115 p/sh).
OPHR: reduce to HOLD (from Speculative Buy) as the agreed PT Medco cash offer of 57.5 p/sh awaits completion.

BE11:23am

So far this year the oil price has been strong, improving from $55/bbl Brent at YE18 to a trading range between $60-65/bbl for much of the quarter and a late run to over $70/bbl currently. Unsurprisingly, this has resulted in generally strong market performance for our coverage list in Q1, helped by corporate activity (FPM early 2019 and OPHR). Certainly, the gloom of Q4 18 appears to have been replaced by cautious optimism in Q1 19. However, our unchanged LT $65/bbl Brent assumption shows that we remain cautious on the sustained longevity of the most recent oil price uptick to $70/bbl, preferring to take a (very moderately) bearish view compared with the current commodity market. Continued US production gains in Q1 and the now long running saga of demand concerns suggest to us that Brent at $65/bbl is still a good working basis.

BE11:24am

Top picks
GKP: Continued strong Shaikan delivery and a cost-effective, rapid timeline to c.70% production growth by early 2020, easily self-funded, and a meaty dividend of c.6.5% at present, make a very appealing combination.
PMO: Oil price gearing and inroads into the admittedly still high net debt are providing a strong rationale for investor interest, supported by the potential for positive Zama and Sea Lion news.
RKH: Very much the geared play on Sea Lion and there should be indications of senior debt availability by this summer. We see an upside skewed investment opportunity on that catalyst alone, and scope for further news in the autumn on the Italian arbitration.
TLW: More limited upside than our other top picks but the summer exploration drilling potential in Guyana adds significant upside with, arguably, no valuation downside at current market levels.

11:34 am
BE11:35am

H2 18 figures demonstrate the turnaround that has been made in improving operational and cash performance, with the dividend reinstated (0.6p) earlier than expected. The shares have performed well (+121% YTD vs sector average 13%) as the benefits from easing of certain external pressures (raw materials and currencies) and actions taken (eg group average headcount reduced by 26% YoY) have seen significant improvement in H2. Management confident that the group can be returned to peak operating margins (10.8% in 2016; H2 margin 9.6%) in “due course”. We believe this could generate EPS of c.9p.

BE11:35am

Results. Unsurprisingly in line with expectations at the headline level (PBT £8.5m), following the January trading update but demonstrate strong progress made in H2. EPS just shy of our estimate (5.4p vs 5.8p E), due to a higher than expected underlying tax charge (27% vs 20% E) reflecting a higher weighting of overseas profits. Dividend reinstated earlier than expected (0.6p) signifying the much improved balance sheet position, confidence in outlook and progress made. OCC sales -5%, including c. -4% in H2 includes an £11.9m (-7%) reduction from UK consumer-facing retail customers; lfl sales for the rest of the group (c. 75% sales) grew 2.4%. H2 adj. gross margin increased to 33.9% (Numis E 33.6%) (H2 17 26.4%) and H2 EBITA margin of 9.6% achieved.

urgeview @red what's on offer...its suspended...zero p is what they are likely to get!
nichoman anyone looked at bidstack at all ? sellings ads in online games sounds good. but given twitter ramping have my suspicious about them
BE11:36am

Estimates. Management’s guidance {“…revenue growth is running in line with expectations…confident of reporting adjusted operating profit for 2019 comfortably ahead of current market expectations”} suggests increased confidence that operational and margin improvements achieved in H2 18 can be sustained. While there are undoubted uncertainties over the UK economy we expect improved gross margins to be maintained and SG&A inflation to be controlled. We have further increased (following the PBT increase of 10% following the January trading update) our 2019 EBITA expectations by £1m from £13.0m to £14.0m (+7.7%) and PBT up 11% from £11.0m to £12.2m (£200k lower interest from improved debt position).

11:36 am
BE11:36am

This is partially offset at the EPS level {+7% to 5.8p} by an increase in our underlying tax rate estimate from 21% to 24%, reflecting the higher FY18 charge and higher expected overseas profits in the mix.

BE11:36am

We have also adopted IFRS 16 in our estimate revisions, which overall is expected to have a limited impact {EBITDA +£0.6m; net profit after tax + £0.1m; lease liabilities of £2.8m brought on balance sheet}.

Punting on mid-stage Phase II trial headlines from a smallcap looks like a fun way to gamble short term ahead of the near certainty of losing money in the long run, but what do I know? Here's Stifel.

11:45 am
BE11:45am

ReNeuron has confirmed that the positive efficacy seen, and previously announced, from the Phase I/II trial with its hRPC retinal programme has been maintained. Recall that on 20 February 2018, the company reported that all three of the first cohort of patients with retinitis pigmentosa (RP) in the efficacy part of the trial had a rapid and significant improvement in vision, on average equivalent to reading an additional three lines of five letters (+15 letters) on the EDTRS eye chart. Significantly, the untreated control eyes did not show significant improvement, with a mean decline of -1 letter. Visual acuity scores are an FDA recognised endpoint for approving eye treatments, and a 15-letter ETDRS improvement is widely regarded as being highly clinically meaningful.

BE11:46am

Dosing of the next three patients, in the second efficacy cohort, has now started, and is treating patients with a greater baseline level of visual acuity than those treated in the study so far. We recognise the relatively small number of patients treated and short follow-up period (18 days to two months) reported so far, but the consistency and maintenance of response is highly encouraging, in our view.

ReNeuron expects to report more detailed data from the trial at the 6th Annual Retinal Cell and Gene Therapy Innovation Summit, taking place in Vancouver, Canada, on 26 April 2019.

11:46 am
BE11:46am

Assuming that further hRPC data continue to demonstrate similarly dramatic and durable responses in vision improvement, we believe ReNeuron will be sitting on one of the most attractive of assets, in an already booming retinal sector in terms of M&A and licensing activity. Reiterate Buy.

BE11:48am

ReNeuron Group plc (AIM: RENE), a UK-based global leader in the development of cell-based therapeutics, is pleased to announce that it has signed an exclusive licence agreement ("the Agreement") with Shanghai Fosun Pharmaceutical Industrial Development Co., Ltd., a subsidiary of Shanghai Fosun Pharmaceutical (Group) Co., Ltd. ("Fosun Pharma"), for the development, manufacture and commercialisation of ReNeuron's CTX and hRPC cell therapy programmes in the People's Republic of China ("China").

Fosun Pharma is a leading healthcare group in China with extensive healthcare business interests worldwide. It is listed on both the Shanghai Stock Exchange and the Hong Kong Stock Exchange.

Under the terms of the Agreement, Fosun Pharma will fully fund the development of ReNeuron's CTX and hRPC cell therapy programmes in China, including clinical development and subsequent commercialisation activities. Fosun Pharma has also been granted rights to manufacture the licensed products in China.

ReNeuron will receive £6.0 million (US$7.9 million) on entering into the Agreement, up to £6.0 million (US$7.9 million) in near-term operational milestones and up to £8.0 million (US$10.5 million) in future regulatory milestone payments. In addition, post-launch profit threshold milestone payments are due at a rate of 5% of annual net profits derived from the licensed products in the year the relevant net profit milestones are exceeded, leading to total estimated milestone payments of £80.0 million (US$104.8 million) provided all milestones and profit thresholds are successfully met.

ReNeuron will also receive tiered royalties at rates between 12% and 14% on sales of the licensed products in the Chinese market. The Company will be responsible for supplying CTX and hRPC cells to Fosun until technical transfer activities have been completed.

Today’s licensing deal with Fosun Pharma represents a commercial breakthrough for ReNeuron. In our view, Fosun Pharma (a
large, reputable company dual-listed in Shanghai and Hong Kong) is an ideal development and commercialisation partner
for ReNeuron’s CTX (Stroke) and hRPC (ophthalmic disorders) programmes in China. The Chinese stem cell market was worth
an estimated $6.4bn in 2016, and is developing rapidly (estimated 2016-22 CAGR of greater than 30%), with several hundred clinical trials
currently underway, propelled by government initiatives and private funding. We look forward to further development and
regulatory updates with great interest, and reiterate our highly positive stance on ReNeuron.

The Group enjoyed a strong inaugural year, opening 11
pubs, which combined with 1.6% LFL growth and margin
improvement helped to deliver 22% revenue growth, 28%
adj EBITDA growth and 42% adj EPS growth. Since yearend the Group has exchanged on two large sites, the Nest
and the Hoste (announced today), which along with the 4
development sites in the estate drives a 6.1%/13.0%
upgrade to our EBITDA forecast for 2019/20 and an
increase in our target price to 280p. The valuation is
undemanding considering the growth, strength of balance
sheet and pipeline development.
